com.biorecorder.edflib

Class EdfJoiner

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biorecorder.edflib.EdfWriter
      • com.biorecorder.edflib.EdfFilter
        • com.biorecorder.edflib.EdfJoiner

  • public class EdfJoiner
extends EdfFilter
    Permits to join (piece together) given number of incoming DataRecords. Resultant output DataRecords (that will be written to underlying EdfWriter) have the following structure:

    [ resultant number of samples from channel_1 ,
    resultant number of samples from channel_2,
    ...
    resultant number of samples from channel_i ]

    Where:
    resultant number of samples from channel_i = number of samples from channel_i in original DataRecord * numberOfRecordsToJoin
    duration of resulting DataRecord = duration of original DataRecord * numberOfRecordsToJoin

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new EdfJoiner to join given numbers of incoming DataRecords and write the resultant DataRecords to the specified underlying EdfWriter

      • writeDigitalSamples

        public void writeDigitalSamples(int[] digitalSamples)
        Accumulate and join the specified number of incoming DataRecords into one resultant DataRecord and when it is ready write it to the underlying EdfWriter

        Call this method for every signal (channel) of the stream/file. The order is important! When there are 4 signals, the order of calling this method must be:
        samples belonging to signal 0, samples belonging to signal 1, samples belonging to signal 2, samples belonging to signal 3,
        samples belonging to signal 0, samples belonging to signal 1, samples belonging to signal 2, samples belonging to signal 3,
        ... etc.

        Number of samples for every signal: n_i = (sample frequency of the signal_i) * (duration of DataRecord).

        The entire DataRecord (data pack) containing digital data from all signals also can be placed in one array and written at once.

        Overrides:
        writeDigitalSamples in class EdfFilter
        Parameters:
        digitalSamples - array with digital data samples
